channel.title: Computer not allowing any connections?
channel.description:
Hey guys, I recently update to Windows Vista ultimate 32bit and I am having a little trouble getting my server to work.
First of all here are the things I have done:
1. Portforwarded ports to my lan ip address (obtained by doing Start>cmd>ipconfig ) 2. Set up a NO-IP ip address. 3. Run the server on the correct port. 4. Added environment variables.
Here are my [url=http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v349/F!_@PPY/envvariables.jpg]Environment Variables[/url].
Text inside classpath: [code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code]
Text inside Path: [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin[/code]
5. Recompiled server ( multiple times ) 6. Opened ports in Windows Firewall.
What else can i do to let players connect to my computer? I can't figure it out. Thanks all![br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 17, 2008, 01:50:42 pm[/size][hr]Oh and i also download JDK 1.7.0 as you can see in the environment variables.

item.title: Computer not allowing any connections?
item.dc:creator: @Foomanshoo Foomanshoo
item.description:
@Foomanshoo wrote:

No this isnt my only base, and yes I tried using my other base source and that aswell did not work.

I have a netgear router[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 17, 2008, 02:19:14 pm[/size][hr]Oh and no I use a server management program but no that doesn’t say anything when im trying to connect.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 17, 2008, 02:24:49 pm[/size][hr]I’m going to try and reset my router, see if that works since i have done it before. I will post the results[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 17, 2008, 02:34:16 pm[/size][hr]Didn’t work… I even tried using a different client ( I dont see how that would do anything but i tried it )

Read full topic

item.title: Computer not allowing any connections?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Cry 0f Death:

If you have everything else completed and your Jdk is up to date try posting your server on the status page while you have your source running.

Your not seeing his problem, His computer Doesn’t allow connections so there would be
No use having it on the Status page,

@Foomanshoo;

Is it only the base your using, Sometimes this can happen with bases so try a different one,
If you already have, Does your Run.bat say anything whilst trying to connect?

And if not, What router do you have?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer not allowing any connections?
item.dc:creator: @Foomanshoo Foomanshoo
item.description:
@Foomanshoo wrote:

Hey guys, I recently update to Windows Vista ultimate 32bit and I am having a little trouble getting my server to work.

First of all here are the things I have done:

  1. Portforwarded ports to my lan ip address (obtained by doing Start>cmd>ipconfig )
  2. Set up a NO-IP ip address.
  3. Run the server on the correct port.
  4. Added environment variables.

Here are my Environment Variables.

Text inside classpath:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Text inside Path:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin
  1. Recompiled server ( multiple times )
  2. Opened ports in Windows Firewall.

What else can i do to let players connect to my computer? I can’t figure it out. Thanks all![br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 17, 2008, 01:50:42 pm[/size][hr]Oh and i also download JDK 1.7.0 as you can see in the environment variables.
